intro: Heteranthocidium pentadactylon, commonly known as the five-fingered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive five-lobed leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The genus Heteranthocidium is part of the Campanulaceae family, known for its ornamental value and ecological significance.
